title: Reduce Excessive Vertical Margins in Workspace Switcher
description: The workspace switcher dropdown has too many vertical margins/paddings, making it feel bloated and taking up unnecessary space. Need to tighten up the spacing for a more compact, professional appearance.

notes.content: Completed: Reduced excessive vertical margins throughout workspace switcher dropdown. Changes: 1) Header padding from 12-8px to 8-4px, 2) Workspace list padding from 8px to 4px, 3) Workspace item padding from 8px to 6px, 4) Actions section padding from 8-12px to 4-8px, 5) Gap between action buttons from 2px to 1px, 6) Item content gap from 2px to 1px, 7) Divider margin from 8px to 4px. Result is much more compact dropdown that feels professional and efficient.

User identified issue: collapsed workspace switcher icon only shows tooltip but doesn't have dropdown trigger functionality. Need to add dropdown to collapsed version so users can switch workspaces even when sidebar is collapsed.

context.businessContext: Clean, compact UI improves user experience by reducing visual clutter and making better use of screen space. Excessive margins make the interface feel bloated and less professional.
context.technicalContext: Current implementation has excessive padding in dropdown header, workspace list, and action buttons section. Need to reduce vertical spacing while maintaining readability and touch targets.
